TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Doin' the Work" Edition

Articles.Content: KSP Version 0.90 (Beta): Yeah, life-support never did make it in, huh?

KSP Version 0.90 (Beta): Yeah, life-support never did make it in, huh?

I believe it's been stated by the developers that they don't see life support as part of their vision of the game (in short, they feel it restricts what you can do without adding much fun in exchange). Will edit in a reference for this if I can find one.

On the other hand, I'm sure they're fully aware that more than a few people enjoy the added realism or added challenge (including me), and aren't going to complain about anyone modding it in.

EDIT: Couldn't find support for my first statement, but I did find this Reddit post, stating that if they ever do include life support it will be a difficulty option that can be disabled.

Edited November 28, 2014 by ArcFurnace

Considering the last update forced my computer to use the lowest graphics setting to even RUN KSP, this update is going to kill it.

Btw, my computer could handle 0.24 on full graphics...

Considering the last update forced my computer to use the lowest graphics setting to even RUN KSP, this update is going to kill it.

Btw, my computer could handle 0.24 on full graphics...

I experienced something similar, in .24 i could run nice 8k cloud textures and still play in 2560 x 1440 in max settings on my iMac. in .25 i had to kick the cloud mod completely and set textures to half resolution. But honestly this is part of the development process. There will be optimizations for sure. Lets wait for what .90 will bring us. I bet, we wont be disappointed.

A few more parts will eat a little bit more RAM, but the difference shouldn't be that big.

I think the SPP parts had a lot more intense textures than the usual parts.

But it could've been anything.

I don't understand why Daniel is baking vertex AO, instead of pixel AO. Surely if you're going for quality it should be pixel AO.

Isn't vertex AO mostly used for real-time shading? In which case it doesn't need to be baked, and the problem of repeated textures disappears.

Sorry if I'm repeating someone's point I didn't read the thread.

I don't understand why Daniel is baking vertex AO, instead of pixel AO. Surely if you're going for quality it should be pixel AO.

Isn't vertex AO mostly used for real-time shading? In which case it doesn't need to be baked, and the problem of repeated textures disappears.

Sorry if I'm repeating someone's point I didn't read the thread.

They're using tile textures rather than UV maps, so pixel AO isn't an option I guess. Still a little bit disappointing though - I know firsthand that doing real UV maps and textures is a huge PITA but there's really no substitute in terms of quality. Even if that amount of work is impractical, you can still go halfway and bake the tile textures onto a UV map, which allows full pixel AO plus you can add a few details on top of the tiles.

So I`ve noticed a dearth of names for the new update.

I like but....

Has "Kommand & Kerbal" ever been used for a update title?

Is anybody else planning an STS 1969 in 0.90?

The one that got cancelled. In 1969. The space shuttle was the only remnant that even came to fruition.

They're using tile textures rather than UV maps, so pixel AO isn't an option I guess. Still a little bit disappointing though - I know firsthand that doing real UV maps and textures is a huge PITA but there's really no substitute in terms of quality. Even if that amount of work is impractical, you can still go halfway and bake the tile textures onto a UV map, which allows full pixel AO plus you can add a few details on top of the tiles.

Squad's art team is pretty small as I understand it and I can see why they'd go this route. I could never have produced the amount of content I have if I bothered with UV maps. Whilst quality may be somewhat compromised it does cut the art pipeline considerably and if done with a little precision, tile textures can still look good. When I can be bothered they can

So there's quite an amount of titles to choose from.
